That's great! Guided tours and lectures can be an excellent way to deepen your understanding and appreciation of street art. They can provide valuable insights into the history, techniques, and cultural context of the art form, as well as introduce you to new artists and styles.

It's fantastic that you attended a lecture on "The Evolution of Street Art" featuring Carlos Ramirez! Lectures like that can be really inspiring and thought-provoking. Carlos Ramirez is likely a knowledgeable and passionate speaker, and I'm sure you learned a lot from his talk.

Guided tours, in particular, can be a great way to explore street art in your community. Many cities offer guided tours of street art murals, graffiti, and other forms of urban art. These tours are often led by knowledgeable guides who can provide information about the artists, their work, and the cultural context in which they created it.

Some tours might focus on specific themes, such as the history of street art in your city, the role of women in street art, or the intersection of street art and social justice. Others might highlight the work of specific artists or collectives.

When looking for guided tours or lectures, you can try searching online for "street art tours in [your city]" or "street art lectures in [your city]." You can also check local art organizations, museums, or community centers, as they often offer guided tours or lectures on street art and related topics.

Remember to take notes, ask questions, and engage with the guide or speaker during the tour or lecture. It's a great way to learn more about street art and connect with like-minded people who share your passion for the art form!
